intro: Hexadesmia monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf hexadesmia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single, large leaf that emerges from a short stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom during the wet season. Hexadesmia monophylla is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
